title.rendered: The indie video game platform itch.io assures that NFTs “are a scam”

content.rendered:
The digital platform of video game independent itch.io has expressed its opinion about non-expendable assets or NFTwhich he has defined as “a scam” and has pointed out as a means to commit fraud.

First glimpse of a lone black hole delights astronomers

Read more

“NFTs are a scam. If you think they are legitimately useful for anything other than exploiting creators, financial scams and the destruction of the planet, we ask you to reassess your priorities in life,” said this store focused on titles without digital rights management (DRM) on Twitter.

A few have asked about our stance on NFTs:

NFTs are a scam. If you think they are legitimately useful for anything other than the exploitation of creators, financial scams, and the destruction of the planet we ask that please reevaluate your life choices.

Peace ✌️

— itch.io (@itchio) February 6, 2022

itch.io it has also accused the companies that support NFTs of wanting to profit from these virtual creations, “especially given the now easily accessible discourse on the problems of NFTs.”

“They only care about their own benefit and the opportunity for wealth at the expense of others,” added the platform in a thread on the social network, where it ensures that non-fungible tokens “they are a scam” and the origin of fraudulent actions on the Internet.

It is worth remembering that the itch.io PC application, which has video games such as Rogue64 (C64), dordle, Dungeon Wizards or Apocalich, has been included in the launcher of the Epic Games Store since April of last year.

Precisely, this company, developer of Fortnite, announced in October 2021 that it was opening the doors of its digital store to video games in which the technology is used ‘blockchain’.

Epic Games It has not been the only one to position itself in favor of NFTs, since others have joined, such as Ubisoft -with the creation of Quartz, a platform for playable NFT files for its games in the form of unique cosmetic elements- and Square Enix.

In the traditional New Year’s message, the president and representative director of the Japanese company, Yosuke Matsudahighlighted the benefits of ‘blockchain’ technology in video games and valued the influence of virtual assets in the sector.

However, the manager insisted on the need to maintain caution in this regard, due to the “trade of digital goods based on NFT’s with somewhat speculative nuances”.

For its part, Valve maintains in its section of conditions for developers who wish to publish games on Steam the prohibition of sharing “applications built with the ‘blockchain’ technology that emit or allow the exchange of cryptocurrencies or NFT”.
